sentence.Network_en: After repeated exhortation by his comrades, he finally straightened out his thinking.
sentence.Network_cn: 经过同志们再三劝导, 他终于想通了.

sentence.Network_en: Miss Bart accepted this exhortation in a spirit of the purest impartiality.
sentence.Network_cn: 巴特小姐心平气和地接受了这种谴责.

sentence.Network_en: Till I come , give attendance to reading , to exhortation, to doctrine.
sentence.Network_cn: 13你要以宣读, 劝勉,教导为念, 直等到我来.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 3. 劝勉（exhortation）：从感情上激励善良动机。4. 环境（enviroment）：创造一个彼此尊重与合作的环境。
在劝勉激励（Exhortation）方面：学校敬师活动，赠送敬师卡、期末感恩活动、惜福宣导，利用班周会、升旗时间宣导品德故事、推 …

stripped of the lure of profit by which they induce our people to follow their false leadership , they resorted to exhortation , pleading tearfully for restored confidence .没有了当诱饵引诱人民追随他们的错误领导的金钱，他们只得求助于讲道，含泪祈求人民重新给予他们信心。

list.abs: therefore I exhort you , be imitators of me .林前4:16所以我求你们效法我。
Emerson exhorted them to " cast behind you all conformity , and acquaint men at first hand with Deity . " "爱默生鼓励他们摒弃一切俗尚，直接和神灵交往。
翻译词典... ... urge ... earnestly 敦切 urge;exhort earnestly 蹲班 yearn for;earnestly hope 渴盼.
千叮万... ... 千叮万嘱 repeatedly urging;imploring over and over again 切嘱 urgent advice;to exhort 十万 hundred thousand.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Latin exhortatio(n-), from the verb exhortari 'encourage' (see exhort)

entry.def: If you exhort someone to do something, you try hard to persuade or encourage them to do it.

example.ex: Kennedy exhorted his listeners to turn away from violence...
example.tran: 肯尼迪劝诫听众远离暴力。

example.ex: He exhorted his companions, 'Try to accomplish your aim with diligence'.
example.tran: 他劝诫同伴说：“要通过勤奋努力实现自己的目标。”

means.word_mean: 1. a communication intended to urge or persuade the recipients to take some action
2. the act of exhorting; an earnest attempt at persuasion

auth_sentence.content: Punishment and exhortation had no effect and psychiatric help was sought.
auth_sentence.res_content: Punishment and exhortation had no effect and psychiatric help was sought.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Punishment and exhortation had no effect and psychiatric help was sought.

auth_sentence.content: Its exhortation seemed to lack conviction.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Its exhortation seemed to lack conviction.

auth_sentence.content: The Archbishop...offering neither exhortation nor rebuke.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Archbishop...offering neither exhortation nor rebuke.

means.word_mean: 敦促,怂恿;极力推荐;(正式的)演讲;(宗教仪式中的)劝诫
